turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: The -- I gather the officers had no difficulty preventing violence?

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: Their part --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: The night of this meeting.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: Their physical present sir, in considerable numbers according to Captain Randall, it was the only that presented the riot.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: And he reached to think that no violence the following night might not have the same result? That meeting in the following night --

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: The situation by that time Mr. Justice could have become so pulverized and so in the flamed that there were not enough state police to the State of Maryland to have controlled it, and that is Colonel Davidson's testimony as well.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: I had noticed that your permanent injunction or your 10 months injunction is considerably narrower than the temporary, the ex parte restraining order.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: Yes sir.
The 10 months injunction as Mr. Justice Stewart indicated coincided with the school term of Maryland State College.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: But it was narrower in the kind of meetings that it prevented.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: I suppose this party could have gone and had meetings under these 10 months injunction.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: The second injunction as you indicate was narrower and that it restrained them from carrying on meetings of such a nature which would intend to incite racial strike.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: What's your justification for the temporary restraining order where it is enjoined all meetings whether they would incite racial violence or not.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: Because the -- simply because the situation was so inflammatory at the time that almost any assembly of persons immediately set off rumors, counter rumors, and drew others to the scene.
The 10 months injunction in fact was not requested by us, this was entered by the court on its own initiative.
The request for 10 months was never asked by us.

turn.speaker: william_o_douglas
turn.label: Justice William O. Douglas
turn.text: I'm still puzzled why you don't discuss the Denis case which is much at issue of burden for the prosecution for the state.
You don't even mention in the brief, or --

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: The court possibly --

turn.speaker: william_o_douglas
turn.label: Justice William O. Douglas
turn.text: Do you think it's just a communist doctrine rather than other than the one you have?

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: The reason I haven't discuss it Mr. Justice because I'm not familiar with it.

turn.speaker: william_o_douglas
turn.label: Justice William O. Douglas
turn.text: Oh, I thought you promised me you were going to discuss it, I'm sorry.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: No sir, we -- the brief here and in the Court of Appeals relied primarily on the original Shank case and the cases --

turn.speaker: john_m_harlan2
turn.label: Justice John M. Harlan
turn.text: The case on writ?

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: Shank sir.
And the cases since then, the Sheplenski and Campwell, Bo and Harris and others.

turn.speaker: william_o_douglas
turn.label: Justice William O. Douglas
turn.text: But under Denis, you don't have to go as far as I read it, to shout fire on a crowded theatre.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: That would be far enough in this community sir.

turn.speaker: william_o_douglas
turn.label: Justice William O. Douglas
turn.text: I beg your pardon?

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: That would have been far enough in this community.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Very well Mr. Jones.

turn.speaker: alexander_g_jones
turn.label: Mr. Alexander G. Jones
turn.text: Thank you sir.
